titleStmt.title: The fable of Ouid treting of Narcissus, tra[n]slated out of Latin into Englysh mytre, with a moral there vnto, very pleasante to rede. M.D.LX.
titleStmt.author: T. H., fl. 1560.
Howell, Thomas, fl. 1568-1581, attributed name.
Hacket, Thomas, fl. 1560-1590, attributed name.
Ovid, 43 B.C.-17 or 18 A.D. Metamorphoses. Book 3. English. Selections.

publicationStmt.publisher: By [J. Tisdale for] Thomas Hackette, and are to be sold at hys shop in Cannynge strete, ouer agaynste the thre Cranes,

notesStmt.note: Signed at end: TH., i.e. Thomas Howell? Thomas Hacket?.
The moralization occupies the bulk of the book.
Running title reads: Ouids fable of Narcyssus.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

place.placeName: hys shop in Cannynge strete, ouer agaynste the thre Cranes
